Posts.Content: A woman who had similar problems tried a holistic approach and it worked. She took 5000 IU of Vitamin D3 daily, pomegranate extract and drank Flor essense tea from the Flora Company in Canada and it did the trick. Her doctor didn't believe it, as most won't. Hope this helps Dan
Posts.Title: Message: Radiation burns

Posts.Content: On Aug 19, 2010 2:45 AM joeys_mom wrote: I have a high grad dcis  it is large and it is all estrogen receptor positve..and it stems from the lymphnode right beneath the collarbone.. I am just taking tomaxifin but it feels to me like it is not getting any smaller.I know the hormon pills take a long time and they supose to stop the cancer from growing.. but would chemo most likeley to shrink the tumor.. I am lost about diffrent oppinions.. any one that is just taking meds and no chemo or surgery .. I am getting very frustarated here..  sabine Sabine,      Have you tried any alternative treatment? Have you checked your vitamin D Level?  I have read chemo really doesn't work for breast cancer in the long run, may shrink the tumor but there is a price to pay down the road. Chemo may awaken the hypernating stem cells of the cancer years later. Have your tried this combination, pomegranate extract, 5000 IU of D and wheat germ extract? The same faulty gene(BRAC 2) causes breast and prostate cancer. Hope this helps Dan

Posts.Content: Sabine, Some items to stay away from are corn products, the problem is that 70% of items in the grocery store have corn products, like corn frutose, corn starch, its the omega 6 you want to avoid. Also stay away from all soda pops. As far as meat and diary products I eat and drink only organic products. I do eat lean meat but it must be organic, I want to get away from growth hormones and diseases like ecoli. As far as vegtebles and fruits organic is a must. I also want to stay away from pesticides and genetically altered food. My water must filtered from flouride and other chemicls. Hope this helps Dan
Posts.Title: alternative treatments.

Posts.Content: I used herbs, essaic tea, supplements, diet to defeat my advanced prostate cancer. Both of these cancer are similar in nature. I will be celebrating my 5th year since diagnosis next month and I am 100% in remission. Dan

Posts.Content: On Apr 04, 2010 5:48 AM hopen wrote: I am interested in reading more about this too.  How did you find info on what sort of alternative treatments to use?  There are so many websites, but you don't know which ones are real and which ones are scams!  My mom has stage 4 kidney cancer and she is willing to try anything.  Hopen,   Thats the hard part of alternative treatments, which is the real deal and which are scams. Personally I started with a holistic MD, that get me on the right track. What I discovered and added was luck, a higher power who knows. The basics are the essiac tea, vitamin C, D, pomegranate extract. Diet is very important. If you would like more information please visit my web site www.alternativeprostatecancer.com Dan

Posts.Title: vitamin d is good for having breastcancer..??

Posts.Content: On Jun 22, 2010 3:44 AM joeys_mom wrote: need some info on this vitamin,, where to get it ,how does it work , and does is help, and does it interfere with tamoxifen? ohh and what kind of antidepressant do not interfere with the tamoxifin.. any one know. thanks again  ,I know i am such a pain in the butt. <3 sabine Dear Sabine  Vitamin D is crucial, according to the University of Copenhagen of activating your T cells of your immune system. Some where between 70 to 90 percent of senior citizens are deficent in Vitamin D. In fact most cancer patients are deficent in D. I take anywhere from 5000 to 10,000 IU of D daily. I can't see where it would interfere with tamoifen, but ask your doctor or better yet research it yourself. As far as where you get it, most health stores carry it or you could buy it online. Be sure it contains D 3. You should have your vitamin D level checked with a simple blood test. Dan
Posts.Title: vitamin d is good for having breastcancer..??

Posts.Content: Since Breast Cancer is a hormone dependent cancer like prostate cancer I am wondering is anybody using holistic treatment to combat this beast? Dan
Posts.Title: Anybody using Pomegranate extract or Vitamin D

Posts.Content: Scienctists have discovered that both Breast and Prostate cancer develope the same way in men and women with a faulty BRCA2 gene. Researcher's beleive that the two conditions maybe treated with similar treatment. Where I am going with this is I treated my advanced prostate cancer with supplements and diet with tremendous success. I also believe that it would be effective for breast cancer and I am wondering is anybody using this or a similar approach. Dan
